key_points: Chris Cuomo was fired by CNN over his conduct and involvement in controversial matters.
Cuomo had been involved in a series of controversies, including providing advice to his brother, former New York Governor Andrew Cuomo, during his sexual harassment scandal.
CNN's decision followed the release of documents by New York Attorney General Letitia James and allegations of sexual misconduct against Cuomo.
Cuomo's firing raises questions about the balance between anchor freedom and journalistic ethics in cable news.
CNN had previously supported Cuomo through various personal and professional controversies.
CNN conducted a standards-and-practices review with law firm Cravath, Swaine & Moore examining Cuomo's actions.
Debra S. Katz, an employment-law attorney, approached CNN with allegations of past sexual misconduct by Cuomo.
CNN faces challenges in replacing Cuomo, considering the changing landscape of TV viewership and expectations for primetime programming.
Similar ethical dilemmas have occurred with anchors at other networks, such as MSNBC's Joy Reid and Fox News' Sean Hannity.
CNN and MSNBC both are considering how to rebuild their primetime schedules in light of recent anchor controversies and departures.
